input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line
The path and file name of the first file to be comared.
The path and file name of the second file to be comared.
Files are by default compared as text files. Valid value: true Note: not applicable to SunOS.
Ignore upper/lower case distinctions during comparisons? Valid value: true

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation succeed? Valid values: true

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">diff </xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${binary compare}') !=0 and '${binary compare}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">-q </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${file1}') !=0 and string-length('${binary compare}') =0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">-a </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${case insensitive}') !=0 and '${case insensitive}' = 'true' and string-length('${binary compare}') =0"> <xsl:text>-i </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">$[file1] $[file2]</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/bin/diff </xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${case insensitive}') !=0 and '${case insensitive}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text>-i </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">$[file1] $[file2]</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">fc </xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${binary compare}') !=0 and '${binary compare}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/b </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${file1}') !=0 and string-length('${binary compare}') =0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/l </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${case insensitive}') !=0 and '${case insensitive}' = 'true' and string-length('${binary compare}') =0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/c </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">$[file1] $[file2]</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Perform File Compare Compares the contents of two files in either text or binary form.
